pros: Great environment to work in and good team
They need people, so if you are desperate then you can get a job.  Need to lower expectations though about pay and benefits.
cons:
Faculty morale is nonexistent.  No faculty members wanted to be on campus.
State insurance is terrible.
Administration does not listen to faculty.
Faculty pay is low for the cost of living (Savannah, GA, Beaufrot, SC, Bluffton, SC, and Hilton Head, SC are not cheap).
Administration salaries continue to balloon while there is no money to take students to conferences, conduct research, or faculty to afford to live in the area.  Literally some faculty members were also bartenders to try to make a living.
Administration continues to add new administrator positions over the summer months without talking to faculty senate.  New position titles are added for senior administrators that come with pay increases and no discussion occurs with faculty about new job titles and what those positions do.  
Faculty manual is out of date.  New positions were created and have no description within the faculty manual.  If you follow the faculty manual, you could receive reprimands for not following the new rules that are not explicitly stated anywhere.

review_title: Don’t come here unless you love the area
pros: Beach, golf, outdoors activities.  The campus is pretty.
cons: Inept leadership that runs like the school as a for-profit.  Students run the show because the university is entirely dependent upon tuition.  Average SAT is 925 and then minimum SAT requirements have dropped several times since I’ve been here.  They will accept just about anyone and the quality of students is mediocre.  There is no planning at all.  There is an extreme shortage of capacity (classrooms, faculty offices) that has been staring  the administration in the face for 10 years and they have done nothing to plan for it.  There are tenured professors sharing 8 x 10 offices.  Decisions made by leadership change regularly and for unknown reasons.
